intro: Brachystegia angustistipulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant is typically found in miombo woodlands and has a moderate growth rate. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
